org.apache.oodt.commons.util

Class FileLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.oodt.commons.io.WriterLogger
      • org.apache.oodt.commons.util.FileLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyChangeListener, EventListener, LogListener

    public class FileLogger
extends WriterLogger
    The FileLogger class is intended to be used with the Log class in order to setup a log file as a LogListener.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    S. Hardman

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileLogger

        public FileLogger()
           throws FileNotFoundException
        Constructor given no arguments. This constructor will create a new log file or append to an existing log file if the specified file exists. The constructor will then call the other constructor with the output stream argument. This constructor utilizes two system properties for specifying the path and name of the log file. They are as follows:

        org.apache.oodt.commons.util.FileLogger.path - If specified, this is the directory where the log file will be found or created, otherwise the local directory will be utilized.

        org.apache.oodt.commons.util.FileLogger.name - If specified, this is the name of the log file to be found or created, otherwise the name will be as follows: "eda_yyyymmddhhmmssSSS.log".

        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the file cannot be opened for any reason.

      • FileLogger

        public FileLogger(OutputStream outputStream)
        Constructor given an output stream. This constructor calls the WriterLogger constructor with the same signature.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - The output stream representing the log destination.
